data.title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Pat Nixon has remained an enigmatic figure, in life and in death. Often derided by critics as “Plastic Pat,” what this biography...
data.meta_description:
thepresidentguy on July 16, 2024: "⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Pat Nixon has remained an enigmatic figure, in life and in death. Often derided by critics as “Plastic Pat,” what this biography of her aims to accomplish is to showcase the real Thelma Catherine Ryan, born and raised on the “loneliest road in the country.” Through this book, we follow Pat through her birth to death, with particular attention given to her early courtship with a young California lawyer named Richard to her time as Second and First Lady. The narrative doesn’t aim to reinvent the biography, but The Mysterious Mrs. Nixon uses the tried and true method of “womb to tomb” narrative to the fullest.

The research here is remarkable, featuring never before released correspondences between Pat, her husband, and some of her colleagues. Detail is in no short supply here. As is the care and affection that author Heath Hardage Lee has towards her central figure. You can’t help but finish this book feeling a similar kinship towards the First Lady, her true grit, her surprising warmth and humor, and passion for doing what was good and decent. Which feels to be the larger point of this book, which is where it deftly succeeds. While at times I wished the story had offered some greater critical introspection, I still found The Mysterious Mrs. Nixon to be a welcome addition to the much needed expanding library of crucial women in American politics. 

I’d like to thank @heath_hlee and @stmartinspress for this advanced readers copy. The Mysterious Mrs. Nixon will be available to purchase on August 6. 

Image Credit: The President Guy
#ThePresidentGuy #USA #History #USHistory #America #Presidents #PresidentHistory #USPresidents #Nixon #PatNixon #MysteriousMrsNixon #Book #Biography #Nonfiction #BookReview #bookstagram #heathhardagelee #FirstLady".
